alert.note: Alert for Lincoln; Pottawatomie; Seminole (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 2:12PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Seminole, southeastern Lincoln and northwestern Pottawatomie Counties through 245 PM CDT... At 212 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 4 miles southwest of Sparks to near Shawnee. These storms were nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Shawnee, Tecumseh, Meeker, Earlsboro, Johnson, Sparks, Bethel Acres and Aydelotte. This includes Interstate 40 between mile markers 182 and 196. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
